definition: to waste/to spend/to consume/to squander/news/(coll.) to delay/to dilly-dally

sentences.english: The traditional way is time-consuming and need great effort.
sentences.chinese: 傳統上這項工作不僅耗力而且耗時。

sentences.english: These methods are time-consuming, labour intensive and limited to research laboratories.
sentences.chinese: 但這些方法都比較耗時耗力，且僅限於研究實驗室。

sentences.english: Developing custom code each time new research is being conducted is very labor-intensive and time-consuming.
sentences.chinese: 每次進行新的研究都開發定製代碼非常耗時耗力。

sentences.english: Foreign language learning is a long endeavor that needs time and efforts.
sentences.chinese: 外語學習是一項耗時耗力的長期任務。

definition: troublesome/to take a lot of trouble to do sth
beyond one's reach or power (to do sth)
to save/to get rid of (so saving space)
quick fix/opportune short cut (around a difficulty)/cheap trick (to get what one wants)/to pull a fast one
to spend (much) effort/to go through (a lot of) trouble
controlled (by sb)/to suffer under a yoke
to be unable to bear or support
